definition: to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear
variant of 殺氣騰騰|杀气腾腾[sha1 qi4 teng2 teng2]

sentences.english: Blend oils and then add to a bowl of steaming water and inhale for five minutes.
sentences.chinese: 混合油，然後添加到一碗熱氣騰騰的水和吸入五分鐘。

sentences.english: Hot and fresh out of the dishwasher.
sentences.chinese: 從洗碗機裏新鮮出爐的熱騰騰的蛋糕。

sentences.english: Nazism was not only nationalism run amok.
sentences.chinese: 納粹不僅僅是殺氣騰騰的國家主義。

sentences.english: And later she would have a cup of hot coffee, coffee with cinnamon.
sentences.chinese: 然後再喝上一杯熱氣騰騰的咖啡，加了香料的那種。

sentences.english: A masked man ran amok in the town square.
sentences.chinese: 一個戴面具的人殺氣騰騰地闖進了市政廣場。
進展慢騰騰得叫人泄氣。

sentences.english: It looked at the cart of steaming hot bean cakes, people just want to pay.
sentences.chinese: 看着推車上那熱氣騰騰的豆糕，讓人只想掏錢。

sentences.english: The room became cloudy with a blue haze of smoke.
sentences.chinese: 藍幽幽的煙使房間霧氣騰騰。

sentences.english: They were then served with hot green tea.
sentences.chinese: 然後主人給他們斟上了熱騰騰的綠茶。

sentences.english: She trekked down to the library.
sentences.chinese: 她慢慢騰騰地走到圖書館。

sentences.english: If you put hot food in the icebox, the ice might melt.
sentences.chinese: 如果你把熱氣騰騰的食物放入冰盒，冰塊會融化。

sentences.english: Along with them came a big, steaming bowl of peas.
sentences.chinese: 和它們一起的，還有一大碗熱氣騰騰的豌豆。

sentences.english: He wiped his hands on his fatigue trousers with a slow thorough motion .
sentences.chinese: 他慢騰騰一絲不苟地把手在破褲子上擦了幾擦。

sentences.english: Dishes of bouillon were brought in hot and hot.
sentences.chinese: 一道道熱氣騰騰的肉湯被端上來了。

sentences.english: A pot of lip smacking clay pot beef soup is ready to be served.
sentences.chinese: 一鍋熱騰騰的砂煲牛肉湯終於可以端上了。

sentences.english: At last they heard feet coming slowly towards the door.
sentences.chinese: 最後他們終於聽到了腳步慢騰騰地向門口走來。

definition: variant of 熱乎乎|热乎乎[re4 hu1 hu1]
(of a vapor etc) to rise/to hang in the air
